snippet: The first Senate vote on raising the debt ceiling could come as early as Friday, but there have been no bipartisan meetings on ending the partial government shutdown.
abstract: Senate Democratic leaders plan to move forward on measure to raise government's legal borrowing limit without any policy strings attached, answering House Republicans' taunts that Democrats would not force their politically vulnerable senators to cast difficult vote; partial government shutdown ends its first week without any bipartisan meetings held or planned.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JACKIE CALMES

lead_paragraph: The first Senate vote on raising the debt ceiling could come as early as Friday, but there have been no bipartisan meetings on ending the partial government shutdown.

headline.main: Senate Leaders Mull Raising Debt Ceiling in Challenge to House
headline.print_headline: Senate Leaders Mull Raising Debt Ceiling In Challenge to House

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
